page.title: 16Events, Faceby
page.content: {Swainby Sheep Sales,}started by local farmers 50 years ago, are held in August, September and October, now in a field on the Faceby Road. On 19th September there was an entry of 4013 sheep; trade was firm and there was clearance of all lambs. The day was fine but the company was smaller than usual because of this year's late harvest. Prices were: Masham ewes to Â£73, Suffolk Cross ewes to Â£57, lambs to Â£47 and rams to 260 guineas. {Fund raising.}For a small village Faceby is outstanding. A mammoth jumble sale in August brought in Â£200; a few days later a car-boot sale was held. Twenty traders each paid Â£5 for a stand, a bric-a-brac stall made Â£80 and, with refreshments served in the Church Hall throughout the afternoon, the takings reached Â£300, making Â£500 in 5 days for church funds.
